Description:
Construction Procedures
The contractor shall provided to the administrator a construction procedure for installation of geosynthetics material 14 days prior to the commencement of any works.

Acceptance of Construction Procedures
Administrator has reviewed construction procedures and provides approval to commence Geosynthetics works

Material Selection
Geogrid Selection
 As Specified in Clause 1 of Annexure MRTS104.1
 Polymeric Geogrid
 Glass fibre Geogrid
Binder Selection
 Class 170 bitumen
 Bituminous CRS Emulsion

Material Conformance Certificate
Material test certificates and results shall be submitted at least 14 days prior to commencement of works

Acceptance of Geosynthetics
Material test certificates have been reviewed and approved/accepted by contractor administrator prior to commencement of works.
Clause:
MRTS104 Cl 7.2
MRTS104 Table 7.2 (a)
MRTS104 Table 7.2 (b)

Description:
Delivery
Pavement geosynthetic reinforcement shall be delivered to the site at least 14 days prior to commencement of installation.

Storage
Geosynthetics have been stored as per below
Product has been clearly marked for batch identification
Not exposed to UV radiation
Not exposed to Moisture
Stored temperature shall be between -15¡C and 80¡C.

Technical Prestart Meeting
At least three days prior to the commencement of any Works related to the placement of the asphalt geosynthetic, the Contractor shall facilitate a Technical Prestart Meeting.

Bond Coat approval
Seal design with bond coat application rate has been approved

Placement Trial
 Placement Trial required Yes No
 Placement trial completed and satisfied

Surface Preparation
No Loose, Segregated or Contaminated Areas on Finished Surface before placing the materials providing a level and uniform ground surface
MH covers, gully pits, kerbs have been protected
All pavement markings have been removed, cleaned

Crack Filling
Existing cracks between 3mm and 10mm shall be cleaned by compressed air or vacuum and will be filled using PMB prior to spray the bond coat and placement of geosynthetics. (No strain alleviating strip is allowed on top or beneath the geosynthetics crack fill area).

Surface Inspection prior to placement
Prepared pavement surface shall be inspected by the Administrator to ensure that the prepared pavement surface is in accordance with MRTS104.

Weather Conditions
Spraying shall not proceed in any of the following situations: 
a) during rainfall 
b) when rainfall appears to be imminent 
c) wind speed > 30km/h
d) Pavement temperature < 50¡C

Bond Coat
a) Sand patch test required Yes No
b) Bond Coat Application Rate _____ l/m2
c) wind speed > 30km/h
d) Pavement temperature < 50¡C

Bond Coat Inspection prior to placement
Prepared bond coat shall be inspected by the Administrator to ensure that the prepared pavement surface is in accordance with MRTS104.

Bond Coat verification prior to placement (Emulsion only)
Where emulsion bond coat used, ensure emulsion completely breaks prior to application of geosynthetics.

Installation
Pavement geosynthetics shall be installed parallel to the road direction with wrinkle and folds removed. Where required the material may be pre-tensioned to eliminate slack. All joins shall be overlapped at a minimum of 300mm.
When required, the pavement geosynthetics may be pretensioned to eliminate slack. This requirement is applicable particularly to uniaxial geosynthetic product.
Clause:
MRTS104 Cl 9.6.2
MRTS104 Cl 9.6.3
MRTS104 Cl 9.6.4

Description:
Overlap/Joints Inspection prior to placement
Completed asphalt geosynthetics joints and overlaps shall be inspected by the Administrator.

Construction bond strength
construction bond strength testing shall be undertaken by the Contractor in accordance with Clause 10.2.5.

Asphalt geosynthetic placement & Inspection
 Placed using application frame
 Placed along the direction of traffic
 Free of wrinkles and folds
 Rolled using rubber tyre rollers
 Ensured the bond coat sticks to the geosynthetics.

Damage Rectification
If any geosynthetic material is damaged before construction it shall be replaced and fixed.

Product Sample
A representative sample shall be taken from the roll(s) to be tested in accordance with ASTM D4354.

Acceptance
 All material compliance met
 All construction compliance met

Lot Conformance
Ensure all test results, HP/WP, NCR and relevant docs are attached and submitted for final lot closure.
